questions.text: Has the Activation Lock been disabled? (e.g., Find My iPhone)
questions.helpText: Find My iPhone must be turned off and a factory reset must be completed prior to finalizing the trade. Go to Settings>iCloud>Find My iPhone. Turn off iMessaging in Settings if migrating from iOS to another OS.
Enter customer's Wireless Mobile Telephone Number in this field. If customer is activating a new line of service, enter the number being ported to Wireless or the new number when assigned.

questions.text: Is the device otherwise free of breaks or cracks in the housing, keypad, hinge, or battery door?
questions.helpText: Look for cracks around charger and other ports cracked hinges and battery covers. All buttons on the keypad or volume/camera buttons should function. The battery door must remain with the device if applicable. Any breaks or cracks should result in a NO answer for this question.

questions.text: Does the Device Power On and Off?
questions.helpText: Power the device completely off and on again. Make sure the device stays on.

questions.text: Is the LCD intact, free of any chips, and functioning correctly?
questions.helpText: LCD should work properly, display all information clearly, and should not contain any dead spots. Any cracks or chips should result in a NO answer for this question.

Including the phone's IMEI or ESN is very important. It is the only way we can identify the phone if it arrives in our facility without a trade-in receipt. You can usually find the 15 or 17 digit IMEI or ESN printed on a sticker under the phone's battery. IMEI and ESN are the same thing - the serial number of your phone. Note: ESN's have two formats, DEC (all numbers) or HEX (numbers and letters). The IMEI or the ESN HEX format should be used. Note: IMEI's can be displayed on most SIM based phones by dialing the code *# 06 #.

promotions.disclaimerText:
Please enter the IMEI of the new device purchased. 
Only devices purchased prior to October 1st are eligible for the additional promotional value.
